name: Integrity vs. Business Quiz / Test | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: In "The Sweet Smell of Success", Tony Curtis gets squeezed and manipulated by  tyrannical Burt Lancaster. Who is the supposed model for the Lancaster character?
questions.explanation:
Walter Winchell.

	It is said that the character was based on Winchell - a once powerful and influential journalist.

questions.text: In "The Apartment", Jack Lemmon's climb up the corporate ladder is stalled when he refuses to let the "big boss" use his place for a rendezvous with Shirley Maclaine. Who plays the boss?
questions.explanation:
Fred MacMurray.

	Classic conflict between morality and practicality. MacMurray is quite good as the unscrupulous Mr. Sheldrake. (Lemmon and Maclaine are also solid.)

questions.text: In "Days of Wine and Roses", Jack Lemmon feels demeaned by the things that he has to do to keep his job. What type of work does he do?
questions.explanation:
Public Relations Worker.

	It's a fine line between keeping a client happy and "procuring". (Lemmon often plays the "good" man who is overmatched by life.)

questions.text: In "Patterns", an employee has to stand up for himself while dealing with a hard-nosed boss. Who plays the beleaguered employee?
questions.explanation:
Van Heflin.

	Heflin is solid (as always) in a confrontational role against a formidable boss (nicely played by Everett Sloane). Quality Rod Serling script early in his career.

questions.text: In "Requiem for a Heavyweight", a boxer must deal with the end of his career while keeping his dignity. Who is NOT in the cast?
questions.explanation:
William Holden.

	Another fine Serling script.  All three stars did some of their best work here. Julie Harris rounds out the cast.

questions.text: In "Seven Days in May", Kirk Douglas must choose between loyalty to a hero and loyalty to his country. Who plays the President in jeopardy?
questions.explanation:
Fredric March.

	Burt Lancaster is the traitor. (Rod Serling did the screenplay.) Wonderful, suspenseful Fletcher Knebel novel.

questions.text: In "Glengarry Glen Ross", the salesmen are placed under enormous pressure to perform. What are they selling?
questions.explanation:
Real Estate.

	David Mamet's Pulitzer Prize play has an all-star cast in the movie version: Jack Lemmon, Alec Baldwin, Alan Arkin, Kevin Spacey, Al Pacino, etc.

questions.text: In "The Man in the Gray Flannel Suit", Gregory Peck struggles to balance personal and corporate life. He is also haunted by memories of the past. What memories?
questions.explanation:
War.

	Combat memories keep intruding. One of Peck's best roles.

questions.text: In "The Fountainhead", Gary Cooper must deal with his refusal to compromise his own creativity. What kind of work does he do?
questions.explanation:
Architect.

	From the Ayn Rand novel, with Raymond Massey and Patricia Neal. (Stay with the novel.)

questions.text: In "Wall Street", Charlie Sheen ingratiates himself with Michael Douglas by providing some inside information. Who is the source of that information?
questions.explanation:
Charlie's father.

	Played by real-life father Martin Sheen. Terrific movie.
